resources.string: toki
o toki tawa jan pi ilo Lichess
mi sona ala e nimi awen mi
mi sona ala e nimi mi
mi wile e ni: o pana lukin e nimi wawa mi lon lipu \"Lichess\"
mi wile pini e lipu mi
sina ken pini e lipu sina lon lipu ni
mi wile toki e jan ike tawa sina
mi wile toki e pakala tawa sina
lon ma Siko pi lipu Lichess
o toki lon ni tu wan: pakala ni li seme? pakala ni li weka la ilo li pali ante seme? nasin seme la mi ken kama sin e pakala ni?

string.name: illegalPawnCapture
string.comment:
Appears as an option for reasons to contact Lichess on the 'contact' page: https://lichess.org/contact#help-enpassant
Players used to routinely write to Lichess stating that there was a bug, or that the other player had hacked their game in some way. In actuality, the player was using the legal move of en passant.
Please translate this string from the perspective of the player who would be selecting this contact option, and call it 'Illegal', even though we know this is a legal move.

resources.string: ijo musi li ken anpa ike e ijo \"jan utala\"
anpa ni li \"anpa tawa\" (\"en passant\"). ona li pona tawa nasin musi.
sina wile kama sona e \"anpa tawa\", o lukin e musi lili ni.
\"tomo awen\" ike li ken
\"tomo awen\" li ken ala lon nasin ni taso: nasin pi lawa mije li jo e ma ni: ijo musi pi jan ante li utala e ma ni.
o sona e nasin pi \"tomo awen\".
sina wile kama sona e nasin pi \"tomo awen\", o lukin e musi lili ni.
sina pali e musi tan lipu anu nasin ma, o lukin e ni: sina ante ala ante e nasin ken pi \"tomo awen\"?
musi li pini ala, taso ijo musi ni li ken ala moli e lawa mije
nasin musi pi kulupu \"FIDE\" li toki e ni lon wan \"ยง6.9\": kulupu tawa li ken moli e lawa mije la, musi li pini ala pi anpa ala.
jan li ken moli e lawa mije kepeken soweli tawa anu (lawa sewi/soweli utala) lon ken ni: jan ante li jo ala e lawa mije taso.
nanpa wawa li ante ala
o musi e musi pi nanpa wawa. musi ante li ante ala e nanpa wawa.
lipu pakala
